channel.title: Tweaking windows, WITHOUT skinning programs!
channel.description:
Hey all! I recently installed windows 2000 again, and i was shocked how ugly it actually was. In this tutorial i'm gonna explain how to edit the best core files of windows. View this list:
If you're on XP, you can use programs like WindowBlinds, but they will slow up your pc, and this is just more fun ;)
[size=14pt]Small file list[/size] [b]shell32.dll [i]- main shell library for icons, dialogs etc.[/i] msgina.dll - [i]Stuff like hardware removal, sound icons etc.[/i] explorer.exe - [i]The start bar, desktop etc.[/i] user32.dll -[i] Start icon flag.[/i] browseui.dll - [i]Windows Explorer/Internet Explorer's library.[/i][/b] These files are all located in [b]%windir%\system32[/b]
These were the most important files. If you found other cool files too, please announce them here :)
[size=14pt]Programs you need[/size] First, let's get [b]PE Explorer [/b] (way better than Reshacker). [url=http://www.heaventools.com/download/pexsetup.zip]Download[/url] After the install, lets install some icon program, such as [url=http://www.icon-creator.net/iconed5.exe]Icon Cool Editor[/url]
[size=14pt]Editing files[/size] Now, fire up PE explorer and open shell32.dll. Press [img]http://upload-image.com/image/1KB73376.gif[/img] and navigate to [b]Icon entry[/b]. Wow, much icons in there, don't you think? Replace every icon you hate, by pressing [img]http://upload-image.com/image/Owz73464.gif[/img]. We have nice icons such as icon cool editor to make your own icons, or pick one from the web/system file. Save shell32.dll in a directory you like, and Replace it. (scroll down)
Repeat this with every file listed above, and the ugly M$ icons will be gone.
[size=14pt]Windows 2000 256 color tray[/size] Also dislike the ugly 16 bit win2k tray? Yea, let's replace it! First, if you have windown 2000 [i]SP4[/i], go [url=http://www.dr-hoiby.com/TrayIconIn256Color/AutoPatcher.php]here[/url] and run the activeX. If you've got any other windows versions, pick yours from [url=http://www.dr-hoiby.com/TrayIconIn256Color/index.php]here[/url] and you're done.
[size=14pt]Replacing files[/size] Bah, fucking windows file protection... "File is already in use!!". No problem with this ownage tool. Download it [url=http://www3.telus.net/_/replacer/Replacer.zip]here[/url]. Follow the inctructions and reboot. Bye bye windows file protection. [b]NOTE: Disable automatic windows updates! Bill will replace the files with the originals, so choose them wisely![/b]
[size=14pt]Internet Explorer tweaks[/size] [b]Replacing icons[/b] I already made a dummy image for you, which you can just replace in browseui.dll (Look under bitmaps). [img]http://upload-image.com/image/Es374205.bmp[/img] [size=8pt](Normal)[/size] [img]http://upload-image.com/image/9G174234.bmp[/img] [size=8pt](Highlighted)[/size] Right click them > Save As and replace ;)
[b]Removing the spinning logo[/b] Make a new textdocument, call it remove_throbber.reg (or whatever you like). Add this in it: [code] REGEDIT4
[HKEY_CURRENT_USER\Software\Microsoft\Internet Explorer\Toolbar\WebBrowser] "ITBarLayout"=hex:0c,00,00,00,4c,00,00,00,74,00,00,00,1a,00,00,00,10,00,00,00,\ 17,00,00,00,05,00,00,00,6a,00,00,00,26,00,00,00,01,00,00,00,e0,00,00,00,e0,\ 01,00,00,02,00,00,00,29,00,00,00,44,00,00,00,04,00,00,00,09,00,00,00,33,00,\ 00,00,03,00,00,00,09,00,00,00,42,00,00,00 [/code] Save and open it. Bye bye :)
Oh, there are some nice things you can tweak for IE in the registry. Browse to [b]HKEY_CURRENT_USER\Software\Microsoft\Internet Explorer\[/b] and search a bit :)
[size=14pt]Transparent desktop icons on Windows 2000[/size] With this tool you can remove the background of the text on your destkop. Put it in your startup folder, i've done it :) See attachment to download ;)
- To be continued, dinner time :D - ~S!ms
P.S: Can some of you be so nice to post some cool tweaks too? I'll include them ;)

/wrists

EDIT: Btw, XN Resource Editor is a good free alternative to ResHack (PE Explorer costs money). Now of course we all know about cracks and such, but for those crack-free people (xD), use XN RE

item.title: Tweaking windows, WITHOUT skinning programs!
item.dc:creator: @S_ms S!ms
item.description:
@S_ms wrote:

Hey all!
I recently installed windows 2000 again, and i was shocked how ugly it actually was. In this tutorial i’m gonna explain how to edit the best core files of windows. View this list:

If you’re on XP, you can use programs like WindowBlinds, but they will slow up your pc, and this is just more fun

[size=14pt]Small file list[/size]
shell32.dll - main shell library for icons, dialogs etc.
msgina.dll - Stuff like hardware removal, sound icons etc.
explorer.exe - The start bar, desktop etc.
user32.dll - Start icon flag.
browseui.dll - Windows Explorer/Internet Explorer’s library.
These files are all located in %windir%\system32

These were the most important files. If you found other cool files too, please announce them here

[size=14pt]Programs you need[/size]
First, let’s get PE Explorer (way better than Reshacker). Download
After the install, lets install some icon program, such as Icon Cool Editor

[size=14pt]Editing files[/size]
Now, fire up PE explorer and open shell32.dll. Press and navigate to Icon entry.
Wow, much icons in there, don’t you think? Replace every icon you hate, by pressing . We have nice icons such as icon cool editor to make your own icons, or pick one from the web/system file.
Save shell32.dll in a directory you like, and Replace it. (scroll down)

Repeat this with every file listed above, and the ugly M$ icons will be gone.

[size=14pt]Windows 2000 256 color tray[/size]
Also dislike the ugly 16 bit win2k tray? Yea, let’s replace it!
First, if you have windown 2000 SP4, go here and run the activeX. If you’ve got any other windows versions, pick yours from here and you’re done.

[size=14pt]Replacing files[/size]
Bah, fucking windows file protection… “File is already in use!!”. No problem with this ownage tool.
Download it here. Follow the inctructions and reboot. Bye bye windows file protection.
NOTE: Disable automatic windows updates! Bill will replace the files with the originals, so choose them wisely!

[size=14pt]Internet Explorer tweaks[/size]
Replacing icons
I already made a dummy image for you, which you can just replace in browseui.dll (Look under bitmaps).

size=8pt[/size]

size=8pt[/size]
Right click them > Save As and replace

Removing the spinning logo
Make a new textdocument, call it remove_throbber.reg (or whatever you like). Add this in it:

REGEDIT4

[HKEY_CURRENT_USER\Software\Microsoft\Internet Explorer\Toolbar\WebBrowser]
"ITBarLayout"=hex:0c,00,00,00,4c,00,00,00,74,00,00,00,1a,00,00,00,10,00,00,00,\
  17,00,00,00,05,00,00,00,6a,00,00,00,26,00,00,00,01,00,00,00,e0,00,00,00,e0,\
  01,00,00,02,00,00,00,29,00,00,00,44,00,00,00,04,00,00,00,09,00,00,00,33,00,\
  00,00,03,00,00,00,09,00,00,00,42,00,00,00

Save and open it. Bye bye

Oh, there are some nice things you can tweak for IE in the registry. Browse to [b]HKEY_CURRENT_USER\Software\Microsoft\Internet Explorer[/b] and search a bit

[size=14pt]Transparent desktop icons on Windows 2000[/size]
With this tool you can remove the background of the text on your destkop. Put it in your startup folder, i’ve done it
See attachment to download

  • To be continued, dinner time -
    ~S!ms

P.S: Can some of you be so nice to post some cool tweaks too? I’ll include them
